Last weekend, over 35% of the
dormitory residences suffered severe stomach cramps and violent
nausea.
The majority of the attacks
occurred between 4 o'clock Saturday afternoon and 5 Sunday morning. By noon on Sunday over 55
Hopkins students were in the infirmary "suffering what appeared
to be food poisoning."
The origins of the attack remain
unknown. From over 103 reported
cases of nausea and intestinal upset, several of the students stated
that they had not eaten in the
cafeteria for several days and at
least two freshman had not eaten
on the Hopkins campus during a
similar period of time.
One upperclassman, subject to
similar difficulties, had lunch on
Friday and then went home for
the weekend. On Saturday he
developed violent stomach cramps
which his family doctor diagnosed
as food poisoning.
